Title: sudo: Privilege escalation
Synopsis:
Two vulnerabilities in sudo might allow local users to escalate privileges
    and execute arbitrary code with root privileges.

Background.Text: sudo allows a system administrator to give users the ability to run commands as other users.

Description.Text:
Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in sudo:

  • Glenn Waller and neonsignal reported that sudo does not properly handle access control of the "sudoedit" pseudo-command (CVE-2010-0426).
  • Harald Koenig reported that sudo does not properly set supplementary groups when using the "runas_default" option (CVE-2010-0427).

Impact.Text: A local attacker with privileges to use "sudoedit" or the privilege to execute commands with the "runas_default" setting enabled could leverage these vulnerabilities to execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges.

Workaround.Text: CVE-2010-0426: Revoke all "sudoedit" privileges, or use the full path to sudoedit. CVE-2010-0427: Remove all occurrences of the "runas_default" setting.

P.Text: All sudo users should upgrade to the latest version:
